@LauraMStuart9 @rattycastle @EnvAgencyNW Salmon and trout numbers (which lay their eggs in the gravel) are in steady decline. Not to mention freshwater mussels in collapse and native crayfish under pressure.

Alternative measures of tree planting and installing leaky dams are being put in place further upstream.

text:
@PorterHaney @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice Hi, I'm not sure about its accuracy but live rainfall data can be found on the gaugemap website.
https://t.co/C2a4fXxiqv

@HanbyAndrew @riteandleft @olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable That's right. Slurry is a modern thing - since the 1970's we've had the machinery and systems to handle it but before that cattle tended to be straw bedded which means the muck is more biologically stable and can be stored in field heaps for spreading when ground conditions allow
